TopicTitle: A option to switch game time or Real time.

Articles.Content:
In ksp the time is base on game time.You need to timewarping to reach day or night.If you are a hardcore player out there and you want realistic time.I suggest that there is a option to switch time like example A game time with timewarping and the Realistic time has no timewarp and is base on real life so if you are in day light the game is also on daylight and if nighttime the game is in night time.

So what you guys think of this?
To be truthfull, you can simply not use timewarp, and thus be always playing in real time. Also, the day-night cycle on kerbin is not the same as earth time, so in can not be synced with real time.

The in-game timer is based on Earth-time, but a kerbal day passes in six hours realtime.

That said, I don't really see the appeal of doing such a thing. I mean, I know there's some hardcore people out there who'd probably love to do this, but...I don't know. They can, as suggested by NIN3, already play in realtime. So...I don't know >_>

A while ago, i (half-jokingly) suggested a special merchandise item: Some cartoon-facade, looking like a space-capsules inside, with a rotatable lamp behind it, that would be connected to your comp and take the data from KSP at runtime to match the light-ambience of the room you are playing in with the one you are experiencing in the game, at any given time. Another idea of the same ilk would be KSP-controlled window-shutters.
